title: 2019 AFC U-16 Women's Championship qualification
text:
The 2019 AFC U-16 Women's Championship qualification is a women's under-16 <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition which decides the participating teams of the <a href="2019%20AFC%20U-16%20Women%27s%20Championship">2019 AFC U-16 Women's Championship</a>.
A total of eight teams qualify to play in the final tournament held in Thailand, four of which are decided by qualification.
Teams.
Of the 47 <a href="Asian%20Football%20Confederation">AFC</a> member associations, a total of 33 teams entered the competition, with <a href="North%20Korea%20women%27s%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">North Korea</a>, <a href="South%20Korea%20women%27s%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">South Korea</a>, and <a href="Japan%20women%27s%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Japan</a>, automatically qualified for the final tournament by their position as the top three teams of the <a href="2017%20AFC%20U-16%20Women%27s%20Championship">2017 AFC U-16 Women's Championship</a> and thus not participating in qualification. The final tournament hosts <a href="Thailand%20women%27s%20national%20under-17%20football%20team">Thailand</a>, despite having automatically qualified for the final tournament, entered to participate in qualification. As a result, a total of 30 teams entered qualification. Due to the increased number of teams, two qualification rounds were scheduled for the first time.
The draw for the first round of the qualifiers was held on 30 May 2018, 15:00 <a href="Malaysia%20Time">MYT</a> (), at the AFC House in <a href="Kuala%20Lumpur">Kuala Lumpur</a>, <a href="Malaysia">Malaysia</a>. For the first round, the 30 teams were drawn into six groups of five teams. The teams were seeded according to their performance in the <a href="2017%20AFC%20U-16%20Women%27s%20Championship">2017 AFC U-16 Women's Championship</a> final tournament and <a href="2017%20AFC%20U-16%20Women%27s%20Championship%20qualification">qualification</a>. The following restrictions were also applied:
Player eligibility.
Players born between 1 January 2003 and 31 December 2005 are eligible to compete in the tournament.
Format.
In each group, teams play each other once at a centralised venue.
Tiebreakers.
Teams are ranked according to <a href="Points%20%28association%20football%29">points</a> (3 points for a win, 1 point for a draw, 0 points for a loss), and if tied on points, the following tiebreaking criteria are applied, in the order given, to determine the rankings (Regulations Article 9.3):
First round.
The first round was played between 15 and 23 September 2018.
Ranking of second-placed teams.
Due to groups having different number of teams (after the withdrawal of Syria from Group E), the results against the fifth-placed teams in five-team groups are not considered for this ranking.
Second round.
The draw for the second round of the qualifiers was held on 7 November 2018, 11:00 <a href="Malaysia%20Time">MYT</a> (), at the AFC House in <a href="Kuala%20Lumpur">Kuala Lumpur</a>, <a href="Malaysia">Malaysia</a>. For the second round, the eight teams were drawn into two groups of four teams. The teams were seeded according to their performance in the <a href="2017%20AFC%20U-16%20Women%27s%20Championship">2017 AFC U-16 Women's Championship</a> final tournament and <a href="2017%20AFC%20U-16%20Women%27s%20Championship%20qualification">qualification</a>. The following restrictions were also applied:
The second round was played between 27 February – 7 March 2019.
Qualified teams.
The following eight teams qualified for the <a href="2019%20AFC%20U-16%20Women%27s%20Championship">final tournament</a>.
Goalscorers.
In total
